description.name: ONCE(Formula)
description.details: Ensures that a dynamic formula is evaluated only once per test case execution. The result remains constant throughout the execution, and a new value is generated on subsequent executions. =ONCE() is invalid for static values (e.g., =ONCE("John")). It supports various dynamic formulas like FIRSTNAME(), LASTNAME(), EMAIL() etc and parameterization with {{...}}.
description.example: =ONCE(=FIRSTNAME("India")) generates a first name once during the test run and retains the value until the test is executed again.

parameters.value: The dynamic formula to be evaluated. Can include functions like FIRSTNAME(), EMAIL(), etc. Supports parameterization with {{...}}.
